item.title: Albemarle 因锂价下滑而出现亏损，但维持 2025 年展望
item.description: 由于超轻金属价格下滑，全球最大的电动汽车电池用锂生产商阿尔伯马尔公司（Albemarle）周三公布的季度业绩出现小幅亏损，但该公司维持了 2025 年的业绩预期。【原文：Albemarle , the world's largest producer of lithium for electric vehicle batteries, posted a small quarterly loss on Wednesday due to sliding prices for the ultralight metal, although the company maintained its 2025 forecast.】

item.title: 阿联酋航空高管称未看到美国关税的影响，但航空公司仍保持警惕
item.description: 阿联酋航空副总裁兼首席商务官阿德南-卡齐姆（Adnan Kazim）周三告诉路透社记者，阿联酋航空尚未看到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税的影响，但由于不确定性持续存在，该公司仍保持谨慎。【原文：Emirates has not seen any impact from U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, but remains cautious due to ongoing uncertainty, the airline's Deputy President and Chief Commercial Officer Adnan Kazim told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 西班牙反垄断机构批准 BBVA-Sabadell 收购案并采取补救措施
item.description: 西班牙 CNMC 竞争监督机构周三批准了规模更大的竞争对手 BBVA 收购萨瓦德尔银行（Banco de Sabadell）的提议，但附带了一些条件，从而为这场旷日持久的恶意收购案扫清了另一个障碍。【原文：Spain's CNMC competition watchdog on Wednesday approved the proposed acquisition of Banco de Sabadell by its larger rival BBVA with certain conditions, clearing another hurdle in the long-running hostile takeover bid.】

item.title: EBay 首席财务官普里斯特将卸任，由 PayPal 前高管接替
item.description: 电子商务公司 eBay 周三表示，其首席财务官史蒂夫-普里斯特（Steve Priest）将于 5 月卸任，由曾担任 PayPal 副总裁的佩吉-阿尔福德（Peggy Alford）接替。【原文：E-commerce firm eBay said on Wednesday that its Chief Financial Officer Steve Priest will step down in May and will be replaced by Peggy Alford, who was a vice president at PayPal .】

item.title: Meta 第一季度收入超出预期
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司周三公布的第一季度营收超过了华尔街预期，这表明尽管人们担心与关税相关的经济增长，但该公司的人工智能工具仍有助于拉动广告收入。【原文：Meta Platforms beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter revenue on Wednesday, signaling that its artificial intelligence-powered tools helped pull in advertising dollars despite tariff-related economic growth fears.】

item.title: 交易量激增，Robinhood 季度利润大增
item.description: 周三，Robinhood 公布第一季度利润增长，原因是该零售交易平台受益于客户在市场动荡时寻求对冲头寸的强劲交易量。【原文：Robinhood reported a rise in first-quarter profit on Wednesday, as the retail trading platform benefited from robust trading volumes from clients looking to hedge their positions amid choppy markets.】

item.title: 高通公司第三季度营收低于预期，股价下跌 6
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm）首席执行官对宏观经济环境和全球贸易表示担忧，并预计其智能手机芯片需求不振。【原文：Qualcomm on Wednesday forecast third-quarter revenue just shy of Wall Street estimates, expecting tepid demand for its smartphone chips as the CEO expressed concern about the macroeconomic environment and global trade.】

item.title: 微软季度营收超预期，人工智能变革推动云计算需求增长
item.description: 由于 Azure 云计算业务的强劲增长，微软周三的季度营收超出预期，这让投资者确信其在人工智能方面的巨额投资正在得到回报，并使该公司股价在盘后交易中上涨超过 6%。【原文：Microsoft topped quarterly revenue expectations on Wednesday on strong Azure cloud-computing growth, reassuring investors that its hefty AI investments were paying off and sending shares in the company more than 6% higher in after-hours trading.】

item.title: 人工智能电力紧张加剧，谷歌资助电工培训
item.description: 谷歌周三告诉路透社，该公司将出资培训数万名美国新电工，因为大科技公司正在深入美国电力行业，为其人工智能扩张寻找所需的大量电力。【原文：Google will fund the training of tens of thousands of new U.S. electricians, the company told Reuters on Wednesday, as Big Tech wades deeper into the country's power industry on its hunt for the massive amounts of electricity needed for its AI expansion.】

item.title: 美国议员警告瑞安航空不要购买中国制造的飞机
item.description: 据路透社看到的一封信称，在爱尔兰低成本航空公司首席执行官表示他将考虑在价格合适的情况下购买中国飞机之后，一位美国资深立法者警告瑞安航空公司，出于安全考虑，不要购买中国制造的飞机。【原文：A senior U.S. lawmaker has warned Ryanair against purchasing Chinese-made aircraft due to security concerns, following comments by the CEO of the low-cost Irish airline that he would consider buying Chinese jets at the right price, according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 主要航空公司要求美国延长削减纽约最低航班要求的期限
item.description: 美国各大航空公司以空中交通管制员严重短缺为由，要求联邦航空管理局将纽约市地区拥挤机场最低飞行要求的削减期限延长至 2027 年 10 月。【原文：Major U.S. airlines have asked the Federal Aviation Administration to extend cuts to minimum flight requirements at congested New York City-area airports through October 2027, citing severe air traffic controller staffing shortages.】

item.title: 巴西考虑限制餐券费用，消息人士称 Pix 系统押金存疑
item.description: 三位了解政府计划的消息人士称，巴西政府正在考虑对银行卡处理商的费用设置上限并缩短结算时间，以削减该国数十亿美元餐券市场的中介成本。【原文：Brazil's government is considering capping card processor fees and shortening settlement periods to cut intermediation costs in the country's multi-billion-dollar meal voucher market, three sources with knowledge of the government's plans said.】

item.title: 美国众议院小组放弃取消联邦贸易委员会反垄断权力的提议
item.description: 众议院司法委员会在共和党领导层将取消美国联邦贸易委员会反托拉斯权力的提案纳入预算方案几天后，于周三改变了这一提案的方向。【原文：The House Judiciary Committee reversed course on a proposal to remove the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's antitrust authority on Wednesday, days after its Republican leadership included the measure in a budget package.】

item.title: 酸奶生产商达能正在努力从美国销售的产品中去除人工染料
item.description: 达能公司美洲业务首席执行官谢恩-格兰特（Shane Grant）周三在接受采访时表示，酸奶制造商达能正在寻求从其在美国的产品组合中去除人工染料，其中包括 Yo Crunch、Light & Fit 和 Oikos 等品牌。【原文：Yogurt maker Danone is looking to remove artificial dyes from its U.S. portfolio, which includes the Yo Crunch, Light & Fit and Oikos brands, said Shane Grant, CEO of the company's Americas business, in an interview on Wednesday.】

item.title: Visa 与人工智能巨头合作简化网上购物流程
item.description: Visa 正与包括微软和 OpenAI 在内的重量级科技公司合作，推出一个新平台，让用户将其网上购物任务委托给人工智能代理。【原文：Visa is partnering with tech heavyweights, including Microsoft and OpenAI, to roll out a new platform that lets users delegate their online shopping tasks to AI agents.】

item.title: 巴西 3 月份创造的正式工作岗位少于预期
item.description: 巴西劳工部周三的数据显示，巴西经济在 3 月份净创造了 71576 个正式工作岗位，低于路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查所预测的 20 万个工作岗位。【原文：Brazil's economy created a net 71,576 formal jobs in March, Labor Ministry data showed on Wednesday, below the 200,000 jobs forecast in a Reuters poll of economists.】

item.title: Visa 和 Bridge 合作推出与稳定币挂钩的卡
item.description: Visa 和稳定币基础设施提供商初创公司 Bridge 正在合作，向拉丁美洲多个国家的客户提供与稳定币挂钩的 Visa 卡。【原文：Visa and stablecoin infrastructure provider startup Bridge are partnering to offer stablecoin-linked Visa cards to customers across multiple countries in Latin America, which the companies say will allow users to make everyday purchases in cryptocurrency tokens.】

item.title: 国内生产总值报告模糊不清，投资者对经济风险知之甚少
item.description: 本周三，尽管美国公布了新的国内生产总值报告，但投资者对美国经济的健康状况仍不甚了解，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）全面征收关税的影响使经济增长信号变得模糊不清。【原文：Investors were left with little clarity on Wednesday about the health of the U.S. economy despite a fresh report on gross domestic product, with the fallout from President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs muddying growth signals.】

item.title: 加拿大央行理事会考虑在 4 月份再次降息
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 巴西斯特凡尼公司寻求在美洲和欧洲进行收购
item.description: 公司创始人兼全球首席执行官马尔科-斯特凡尼尼（Marco Stefanini）表示，总部位于巴西的全球技术咨询公司斯特凡尼尼集团计划在2027年底前斥资20亿雷亚尔（约合3.5亿美元）进行收购。【原文：The Stefanini Group, a global tech consultancy firm based in Brazil, plans to spend 2 billion reais ($350 million) on acquisitions by the end of 2027, said Marco Stefanini, the company's founder and global CEO.】

item.title: 美国黑人农民在关税动荡中迎接冲击
item.description: 作为第四代农民，弗吉尼亚州居民小约翰-博伊德（John Boyd Jr）通常会在繁忙的春季准备他的土地，种植甜玉米种子和大豆。【原文：As a fourth generation farmer, Virginia resident John Boyd Jr typically spends the busy spring season prepping his land to plant sweet corn seeds and soybeans.】

item.title: 尼日利亚法官将 Binance 逃税案延期至 5 月 12 日审理
item.description: 尼日利亚一名法官周三将针对全球最大加密货币交易所的逃税案延期至下个月，因为税务部门要求允许通过电子邮件向 Binance 送达法庭文件。【原文：A Nigerian judge on Wednesday adjourned a tax evasion case against the world's largest crypto exchange until next month after the revenue service asked for permission to serve court documents by email to Binance.】

item.title: 美国移动预计 2025 年资本支出为 67 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥电信巨头 America Movil 的一位高管周三表示，该公司 2025 年的资本支出将为 67 亿美元，低于 2024 年 71 亿美元的资本支出。【原文：An executive of Mexican telecoms giant America Movil said Wednesday that the company's capital expenditure for 2025 would be $6.7 billion, below the $7.1 billion capex in 2024.】

item.title: 数据显示，关税引发的波动导致衍生品相关保证金催缴激增
item.description: 根据提供交易后服务的 OSTTRA 公司的数据，在特朗普政府本月宣布对美国征收高于预期的关税后，对冲基金和其他市场参与者的衍生品相关保证金催缴额几乎增加了两倍，在暂停 90 天后又有所下降。【原文：The value of derivative-related margin calls at hedge funds and other market participants nearly tripled after the Trump administration announced larger-than-expected U.S. tariffs this month, before declining after a 90-day pause, according to OSTTRA, which provides post-trade services.】

item.title: 摩根大通任命主要商业银行部门新领导层
item.description: 摩根大通周三表示，在继续重组商业银行业务的同时，已任命安德鲁-克雷斯（Andrew Kresse）和布莱恩-兰姆（Brian Lamb）领导该部门的两个关键部门。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has appointed Andrew Kresse and Brian Lamb to lead two key sectors in its commercial banking business, the largest U.S. lender said on Wednesday, as it continues to reorganize the unit.】

item.title: 沃尔玛恢复对 SNAP 订单收取最低购物篮费
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份备忘录，并经沃尔玛证实，沃尔玛将恢复对有资格获得美国政府援助的顾客和订阅沃尔玛+ 援助计划的顾客收取最低购物篮费。【原文：Walmart is reinstating a minimum basket fee for customers who qualify for U.S. government assistance and those subscribed to its Walmart+ Assist program, according to a memo seen by Reuters and confirmed by Walmart.】

item.title: 美国参议院将就经济萎缩之际控制特朗普关税的议案进行表决
item.description: 美国联邦政府报告称，在总统关税政策的混乱影响下，美国经济出现了三年来的首次萎缩，几个小时后，美国参议院准备在周三就一项阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统一系列关税措施的决议进行投票。【原文：The U.S. Senate was poised on Wednesday to vote on a resolution to block a host of President Donald Trump's tariffs, hours after the federal government reported that the nation's economy contracted for the first time in three years amid the chaos of the president's tariff policies.】

item.title: GlobalData 收到 ICG 和 KKR 管理的基金的收购提案
item.description: 英国 GlobalData 公司周三表示，已收到私募股权集团 ICG 和 KKR 管理的基金提出的初步收购建议，公司股价最高上涨了 35.9%。【原文：Britain's GlobalData said on Wednesday it had received preliminary takeover proposals from funds managed by private equity groups ICG and KKR , sending its shares up as much as 35.9%.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意法半导体拒绝让股东投票选举意大利董事会候选人的要求
item.description: 周三，两位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，意法半导体（STMicroelectronics）拒绝了意大利政府任命其候选人进入该芯片制造商监事会的新尝试。【原文：STMicroelectronics has rebuffed a fresh Italian government attempt to appoint its candidate to the chipmaker's supervisory board, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 空中客车公司呼吁恢复飞机及零部件免税地位
item.description: 空中客车公司周三呼吁尽快恢复 30 多个国家之间的 1979 年协议，该协议几十年来一直确保飞机和零部件的免税贸易，直到最近爆发贸易战。【原文：Airbus called on Wednesday for a swift return to a 1979 agreement between more than 30 countries that for decades ensured duty-free trading for aircraft and parts until the recent eruption of a trade war.】
